title.narrative: Citizen Engagement for Local Government Accountability
Citizen Engagement for Local Government Accountability

description.narrative:
NDI har ansökt hos Sida om finansiering med 3 miljoner USD (26.2 miljoner SEK) för att genomföra programmet '' Citizen Engagement for Local Government Accountability '' i Mali under perioden 2020-2023, huvudsakligen i regionerna Mopti och Sikasso.
Det specifika målet med det föreslagna programmet är att: Lokala myndigheter ska bli mer lyhörda och ansvarstagande gentemot medborgarna. Två specifika resultat förväntas: 1. Medborgarna organiserar och vidtar åtgärder för att söka ansvar från lokala myndigheter 2. Lokala myndigheter ska aktivt inbjuda till medborgardialog vid beslut samt svara upp mot medborgarnas krav. NDI kommer att genomföra denna insats tillsammans med lokala civilsamhällsorganisationer.
Insatsens totala budget är 26 829 090 SEK, varav organisationens egen finansiering är cirka 26.2 miljoner SEK (3 miljoner USD). Ett belopp om 600 000 SEK kommer att innehållas av Sida för att genomföra en slutlig extern utvärdering.

NDI has applied to Sida for funding 3 Million USD (26.2 Million SEK) to carry out the program ‘’Citizen Engagement for Local Government Accountability’’ in Mali during the period 2020-2023, particularly in the regions of Mopti and Sikasso.
The specific objective of the proposed program is that: Local governments become more responsive and accountable to citizens. Two specific results are expected: 1. Citizens organize and take action to seek accountability from local government 2. Local officials actively seek citizen input on decisions and respond to citizen concerns. NDI will implement this intervention together with local civil society organizations.
The intervention’s total budget is 26, 829, 090 SEK, out of which the organization’s own funding is approximately 26.2 million SEK (3 million USD) and 600 000 SEK will be retained by Sida for a final external evaluation.

Proposed by NDI for three years (2020-2023), the overarching goal of the three-year program is to enhance citizen engagement, and expectations of accountability based on experience, that would renew citizens’ confidence in Mali’s local level institutions. The specific objective of this intervention is the following: Local governments become more responsive and accountable to citizens. It ambitions to promote citizens’ involvement and participation in local affairs while elected officials would be equipped to provide better services and response to citizens’ demands. The program will intervene in the regions of Mopti and Sikasso, specifically in eight (08) communes. By the end of the intervention, the following results are expected:1. Citizens organize and take action to seek accountability from local government As outputs, NDI will work to make CSOs gain community organizing capacities, actively engage local governments and monitor local government actions and political processes. 2. Local officials actively seek citizen input on decisions and respond to citizen concernsAs outputs, NDI will work to get Local officials understand their roles and responsibilities, and those of citizens, in governance, development and political processes, and gain skills and capacities needed to deliver services more effectively

title.narrative: Decision on contribution on CITIZEN ENGAGEMENT FOR LOCAL GOVERNMENT ACCOUNTABILITY

description.narrative: During this reporting period, NDI hired and trained seven full-time staff for the CELGA program, thereby expanding its personnel and capacities in Mali. Through the opening of regional satellite offices and the hiring of two regional coordinators, NDI took important steps to extend its reach in the target regions of Sikasso and Mopti. NDI uses the two offices as spaces to foster discussion and collaboration with the communities and their local CSOs. NDI also raised awareness about the CELGA programs mission and objectives among local authorities through meetings with village chiefs of the eight target communes as well as other potential but ultimately non-selected communes. NDI developed a methodology and carried out a baseline assessment of several communes. The baseline assessment enabled NDI to identify CELGAs target communes as well as their needs. As such, the findings of the baseline assessment were then used to inform a program launch retreat attended by six GRAT staff, eight NDI staff, local and national authorities, TV and written press and CSO partners. NDI trained members of local partner GRAT to enhance the CSOs capacities in proposal development, drafting and budgeting. The training was instrumental in providing GRAT with the tools required to develop its subgrant proposal. NDI awarded GRAT a subgrant for $234,371 to carry out community organizer trainings, commune priority needs identifications, establishment of Inclusive Groups in each commune, individual action plan development, and political process monitoring.
